arm_group.arm_group_label: lysine intake at different levels of intake

brief_summary.textblock: The lysine requirement of elderly female subjects 65-75 years old will be 40-45 mg/kg/day.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lysine Requirements of Elderly Female Subjects 65-75 Years Old.
clinical_study.condition: Lysine Requirement in Elderly Female Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
Currently there are no studies on lysine requirement in the elderly.

      The goal of this study therefore is to measure the lysine requirement of female elderly
      subjects 65-75 years using the IAAO technique.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:65-75 years old, non diabetic, not obese, willing to participate in the
        study.

        -

        Exclusion Criteria:diabetes, obese.

        -

intervention.arm_group_label: lysine intake at different levels of intake
intervention.intervention_name: Lysine intake provided as a milkshake

clinical_study.keyword: lysine, indicator amino acid oxidation, elderly females

primary_outcome.measure: change in oxidation of phenylalanine in response to increasing lysine intake

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Senior Scientist, The Research Institute, Hospital for Sick Children

secondary_outcome.measure: phenylalanine oxidations determined from urinary phenylalanine enrichments

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
